an4.23:4.1: “Mendicants, the world has been understood by a Realized One;
an4.23:4.2: and he is detached from the world.
an4.23:4.3: The origin of the world has been understood by a Realized One;
an4.23:4.4: and he has given up the origin of the world.
an4.23:4.5: The cessation of the world has been understood by a Realized One;
an4.23:4.6: and he has realized the cessation of the world.
an4.23:4.7: The practice leading to the cessation of the world has been understood by a Realized One;
an4.23:4.8: and he has developed the practice leading to the cessation of the world.
an4.23:5.1: In this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—whatever is seen, heard, thought, cognized, searched, and explored by the mind, all that has been understood by a Realized One.
an4.23:5.2: That’s why he is called the ‘Realized One’.
an4.23:6.1: From the night when a Realized One understands the supreme perfect awakening until the night he becomes extinguished—through the natural principle of extinguishment without anything left over—everything he speaks, says, and expresses is real, not otherwise.
an4.23:6.2: That’s why he is called the ‘Realized One’.
an4.23:7.1: The Realized One truly does as he says, and really says as he does.
an4.23:7.3: that’s why he is called the ‘Realized One’.
an4.23:8.1: In this world—with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this generation with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—the Realized One is the undefeated, the champion, the universal seer, the wielder of power.
an4.23:8.2: That’s why he is called the ‘Realized One’.”
an4.23:9.1: “Directly knowing the whole world as it is,
an4.23:9.3: he is detached from the whole world,
an4.23:10.4: extinguishment, fearing nothing from any quarter.
an4.23:11.1: He is the Buddha, with defilements ended,
an4.23:11.3: He has attained the end of all karma,
an4.23:11.4: freed with the end of attachments.
an4.23:12.1: That Blessed One is the Buddha,
an4.23:12.3: in all the world with its gods,
an4.23:13.1: And so those gods and humans,
an4.23:13.2: who have gone to the Buddha for refuge,
an4.23:13.4: the great one, rid of naivety:
an4.23:14.1: ‘Tamed, he is the best of tamers,
an4.23:14.2: peaceful, he is the seer among the peaceful,
an4.23:14.3: liberated, he is the foremost of liberators,
an4.23:14.4: crossed over, he is the most excellent of guides across.’
an4.23:15.2: the great one, rid of naivety.
an4.23:15.3: In the world with its gods,
